Name: Apertium
Platform: Cross-platform (Web application)  Unix compatible Precompiled packages available for Debian
Notes: Rule-based  shallow transfer; all programs and language data are free and open source

Name: Anusaaraka
Notes: Rule-based  deep parser based  paninian framework based; all programs and language data are free and open-source

Name: IBM
Notes: Both rule-based and statistical models developed by IBM Research. Neural Machine Translation models available through the Watson Language Translator API for developers.[1][2]

Name: Moses
Notes: Drop-in replacement for Pharaoh  features factored translation models and decoding of confusion networks.

Name: Moses for Mere Mortals
Notes: Free open source; based on Moses; translation memories integration.

Name: NiuTrans
Notes: Competitive performance for Chinese translation tasks; statistical machine translation. Supports phrase-based  hierarchical phrase-based  and syntax-based (string-to-tree  tree-to-string  and tree-to-tree) models for research purposes.

Name: Bing Translator
Notes: Microsoft's linguistically informed statistical MT system

Name: Babylon
Price: Depends on license ($9.90–$89 for one license)
Notes: Prompts to install the Babylon Toolbar  a browser hijacker which is difficult to remove.[5][6]
